wsknn.weighting package¶

Submodules¶

wsknn.weighting.item_weighting module¶

inv_pos_item_score(i)[source]¶

Function returns the final rank as a simple inverse of the item position.

Parameters:
iint

Item position.
Returns:
resultfloat

Inverted position rank.
linear_item_score(i)[source]¶
Function weights events based on their position in a sequence. Output is normalized to the range [0:1]. For the
long sequences of events (index 10+) it returns zero.
Parameters:
iint

Item position.
Returns:
resultfloat

Linear rank.
log_item_score(i)[source]¶
Function returns rank as a transformed inverted log10 of the sum (position + 1.7).
Result is normalized to the range (0:1].
Parameters:
iint

Item position.
Returns:
resultfloat

Logarithmic rank.
quadratic_item_score(i)[source]¶
Function is similar to inverted and linear functions but weights are decreasing at non-linear rate
and accelerate with the item position.
Parameters:
iint

Item position.
Returns:
resultfloat

Inverted square position rank.

wsknn.weighting.session_weighting module¶

linear_session_score(i, length)[source]¶

Newest elements in sequence => largest weights.

Parameters:
iint

Element position, i+1 must be less than length.

lengthint

Length of a sequence.
quadratic_session_score(i, length)[source]¶
Function penalizes old elements in sequence more than the new events. The past elements have much smaller
weights than the new ones. It follows a quadratic function.
Parameters:
iint

Element position, i+1 must be less than length.

lengthint

Length of a sequence.
